Title: BDSM: an introduction to Kink
Book Description: Handcuffs - Riding crops - Whips - Chains. Does some of this excite you?  Curious about BDSM? Then come join us for a short introductory class where you'll learn about different- simple types of play to get you started. Easy things to try tonight!

Title: Fire Play and Massage
Book Description: Come with all your questions about sex and safety- and we'll talk about how to keep safe and stay healthy!

Title: Artificial Intelligence in Anime
Book Description: Come talk about different way Artificial Intelligence has been presented in Anime over the years. This discussion will include classics all the way through modern day. We'll take a look at how AI presented in Anime has changed over the years as well as some ways it has stayed the same. We'll touch on the good- the bad- and the ugly.  Audience participation is strongly encouraged!

Title: Q&A With Ann Lemay
Book Description: Join Guest of Honor Ann Lemay for a Q&A on writing narratives for video games like Bioshock and Mass Effect.

Title: The Art of Retro Gamers
Presenters: Ian Sterrett, Bob Waltenspiel, Jeremy Myers, Dave Phillips
Book Description: Journey to a panel in time discussing how fun it was to play games like Super Mario- Duck Hunt - Battle Toads and Dragon Warrior.

Title: Is It Necessary to Unplug to Unwind?
Book Description: We have all heard the advice about taking time to remove ourselves from our digital devices- but is that really necessary?  Can one utilize technology to relax after a long day of using technology?

Title: LGBTQ identities.
Presenters: Jen Schwartz, Matt Sweet, Max Issac
Book Description: Let's talk about LGBQT identities

Title: Raising Kind and Conscious Kids
Presenters: Biz Nidjam, Jen Talley, Ruth Suehle
Book Description: With so many influences in our kids' lives- how to we give them the tools to make kind and conscious decisions both for themselves and in how they treat and interact with others?  How do we help them to understand and navigate the subtle pressures of the media- their peers- other adults?  How do we help them understand that intent isn't magic- and fair does not always mean equitable?

Title: The Lighter Side of Poly
Book Description: Jennifer Resibig
Private: So- you've figured out that you should communicate- and you know what jealousy is.  What next?  Come together with those of us who have been at this a while and discuss some more advanced polyamory topics such as introducing new polyfolk into an established poly network- dealing with life changes within the poly network- trying the things we tell newbies not to try- and more.

Title: Ann Leckie reading
Book Description: Join Guest of Honor Ann Leckie for a reading and a chance to have your books signed.

Title: Cathrynne Valente reading
Book Description: Join Guest of Honor Cathrynne Valente for a reading and a chance to have your books signed.

Title: , When being 'on' is part and parcel of what people expect
Book Description: A panel where Mark Oshiro (Mark Does Stuff) and Tanya DePass (I Need Diverse Games) speak about the performative aspects of their work- including the need to entertain while doing blind reads and reactions to media and for Tanya; while streaming on Twitch/YT Gaming.

Title: The Return of Mary Sue
Presenters: Ann Lemay, Ann Leckie, Merrie Haskell
Book Description: The concept of the Mary Sue is back with the criticisms of Star Wars Episode VII's Rey as an unrealistic hero. How does this critique of female characters impact our perceptions of competent women?  Why do men get unrealistic idealized male characters as heroes as the norm in SFF media- but female characters with the same traits are ridiculed?

Title: Creating Safer Spaces
Presenters: Mark Oshiro, Tanya DePass, Mari Brighe, Scott Kennedy, Sal Palland
Book Description: Temporary description

Title: So This Is Your First Penguicon
Book Description: Our chair- Scott- will talk about why Penguicon is an awesome con and community- and give you a tour of what's in store for you this weekend.  If you're new to Penguicon and you want to get to know the event- this is the panel for you!

Title: Data Analysis using Python
Book Description: Learn about Loading- wrangling- visualizing- and plotting data using Python- NumPy- Pandas- and the IPython interactive development and computing environment.

Title: E-Nable Update
Book Description: A snapshot of the last 12 months of E-Nable the Future- the 3d-printed arm clearinghouse charity that Penguicon highlighted last year. What has happened between Penguicon 2015 and 2016? What is coming up next? Bring your questions and ideas!

Title: Intro to OpenBSD
Book Description: OpenBSD is a variety of Unix that is similar to Linux- but with perhaps a stronger security focus. It is a project run by volunteers- and is a free software program. Come and learn more about this alternative operating system.

Title: Intro to Python
Book Description: Python is one of the most used programming languages on the Web- so come and get your feet wet with this tool- then stay for the Python Code Walk-Through that follows

Title: Python Code Walk-Through
Book Description: Follow-up to the Intro to Python- our presenter from the Ann Arbor Python Users Group will take you through some actual code.

Title: Simple Python Mobile Web App
Book Description: Smart phones (or other mobile devices) with digital cameras and web access provide an excellent way to record time and place along with a picture. We'll look at code for some example web applications: a photo food diary with time and location- and a hiking/biking record which can extend to mapping.
